result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtisha L. Adams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtisha L. Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court in person for Curtisha L. Adams.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense Counsel files a motion to adjourn the Jury Trial date. Needs more time to review the Autopsy Report and the Cell Phone Records. Also, Co-Counsel is unable to appear due to medical issues. Court grants the motion. Matter is adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Motion To Adjourn, Received and Filed
Motion To Permit Violent Conduct, Received and Filed

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court in person, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court in person for Curtisha L. Adams.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court in person for Curtisha L. Adams.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Final Pretrial held on the record.  Parties request to adjourn the Trial date for more time to process documents and case details. Court denies the motion for adjournment. Case remains set for Jury Trial on November 7, 2022. Court orders the case be set for a final Status before the Jury Trial date. Matter is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List Continued, Received and Filed
State's Witness List, Received and Filed
Received and Filed
Motion In Limine, Received and Filed
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, Signed and filed.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams, in custody, in court with attorney Schwarz and attorney Hotchkiss.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court to schedule a jury trial.  State has begun to review discovery.  Parties remain in negotiations and request a final pretrial and jury trial.  An offer has not yet been provided.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial.  A pretrial scheduling order to be submitted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court with attorney William Hotchkiss and attorney Jeff Schwarz.  Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. (3 day jury trial). Due to scheduling conflict defense requests scheduling conferenc date to pick jury trial date before rotating Judge. Court grants request.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for request for Substitution.  The Hearing was held in person.   Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to  Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Case adjourned to Branch 15 for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case calendared for a Hearing this date.  Court is in Trial on another matter.  Hearing is adjourned to June 21, 2022, at 1:30 pm.  Case will be held in person before Judge Sanders.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Parties emailed May 26, 2022 to address date for substitution.  bm

**Notes:  Parties agree via email to June 1, 2022 at 9:00 am.**

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Curtisha L. Adams not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Scheduling Conference held.l  Defense requests status date.  Court grants request.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz and William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense advised that they have received discovery but not an offer. Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements, signed and filed.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz and Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Flores. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney William Hotchkiss/ Attorney Jeff Schwarz received and filed
Attorney William Hotchkiss/ Jeff Schwarz received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with CLG, dob 7/6/1999
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Curtisha L. Adams in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtisha L. Adams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
